colony allowed gambling however The a   wikiMassachusetts_Bay_Colony Massachusetts Bay ColonyMassachusetts Bay Colonya for example did not allow cards dice or gaming tables even in private residences sup id cite_ref History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States_2 1 class referencea   cite_note History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States 2&91;2&93;asup In most colonies however gambling was seen as a 2&91;2&93;asupn ppThe acceptance of gambling in the colonies was fairly short lived by English investors because it was seen as a sign of laziness and as a vice sup id cite_ref History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States_2 3 class referencea   cite_note History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States 2&91;2&93;asup The investors saw gambling as a root cause of the colonies inability to sustain themselves sup id cite_ref History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States_2 4 class referencea   cite_note History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States 2&91;2&93;asupn ppLotteries were used not only as a form of entertainment but as a source of revenue to help fund the colonies The financiers of a   wikiJamestown _Virginia Jamestown VirginiaJamestown Virginiaa for instance funded lotteries to raise money to support their colony sup id cite_ref History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States_2 5 class referencea   cite_note History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States 2&91;2&93;asup These lotteries were quite sophisticated for the time period and even included instant winners sup id cite_ref History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States_2 6 class referencea   cite_note History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States 2&91;2&93;asup Not long after each of the 13 original colonies established a lottery system to raise revenue sup id cite_ref History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States_2 7 class referencea   cite_note History_of_Gambling_in_the_United_States 2&91;2&93;asupn ppIn early American history legislators commonly authorized lotteries
